snippet: A dispute over how to combat the threat of homegrown Islamic extremism in British schools has provoked a political crisis, prompting a public apology and a resignation.
abstract: Dispute over how to combat threat of homegrown Islamic extremism in British schools has reached political crisis, resulting in personal intervention from Prime Min David Cameron; debate's fallout has resulted in apology from Education Sec Michael Gove and resignation of aide to Department of the Home Sec Theresa May; rift follows allegations that Islamic fundamentalists planned to infiltrate schools in Birmingham.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

lead_paragraph: A dispute over how to combat the threat of homegrown Islamic extremism in British schools has provoked a political crisis, prompting a public apology and a resignation.

headline.main: Rift Deepens in Britain Over Claims of School Infiltration Plot by Islamic Extremists
headline.print_headline: Britain’s Rift on Schools and Islam Grows Wider
